alert.note: Alert for Butler; Calhoun; Cerro Gordo; Franklin; Grundy; Hamilton; Hancock; Hardin; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Webster; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 28 at 8:55PM CST until January 29 at 11:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Light Snow Continues Over the Northern Half of Iowa Tonight, then Bitter Cold Overnight... Light falling snow and areas of blowing snow will linger into the night across the northern half of Iowa with additional accumulations of an inch or less. Cold air will also continue to settle in overnight with wind chills dropping into the teens and 20s below zero. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of an inch or less. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero by Sunday. * WHERE...Portions of northern Iowa. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered and slippery road conditions at times. Blowing snow could reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
